identification.description: A structure used to describe the reason why a party (i.e. lender) may be            ineligible to vote on a legal action approval.

codes.description: Lender holds a commitment in a covenant light structure, and therefore is                    not eligible to vote on the legal action.
The Lender is a defaulting lender, per Credit Agreement criteria, and is                    therefore ineligible to vote on approval.
The lender's share of the deal or facility is insufficient for the lender                    to be eligible to vote.
There is a legal injunction prohibiting a lender from voting.
